&ltTBL>.ENCRYPT() Syntax Result_Flag as L = &ltTBL>.ENCRYPT( [ Encryption_Key as C ] ) ArgumentDescription Encryption_KeyOptional. Default = default encryption key set by the DEFAULT_ENCRYPTION_KEY_SET() function. The character string to use as the encryption key.
Description The &ltTBL>.ENCRYPT() method encrypts the table referenced by the object pointer, &ltTBL>. Result_Flag is .T. if the operation is successful. If Encryption_Key is not specified, Alpha Anywhere uses the default encryption key. The default encryption key can be changed using the DEFAULT_ENCRYPTION_KEY_SET() function. Alpha Anywhere requires exclusive access to the table in order to encrypt it. Example Encrypt a table using the default key. dim t as P t = table.open("customer") t.encrypt() t.close()
Encrypt a table using a specific key. dim t as P t = table.open("customer") t.encrypt("swordfish") t.close()
See Also Table Functions and Methods, Encryption Functions and Methods
